availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The Commonwealth of Kentucky to any Sheriff or constable of Bullitt County

It apearing that there are reasonable grounds for believing that Wm L Bishop Henry W. Bishop and Marion Porter. has comited the ofence of asault and batery on the person of Clifton Hall in the County of Bullitt, you are therefore comanded forthwith to arest William L Bishop Henry W. Bishop and Marion Porter, and bring them before me or some other Justice of the peace, of Bullitt County to be dealt with acording to law.
Given under my hand as a Justice of the Peace of Bullitt County, this 2d day of December 1865 --
Wm Fox J, P, B, C,

Names of Jury as far as I can recolect
Peyton Burditt
John Hall
Reuben Settle
Asa Hall
Larkin Fields
Dr G F. Callings
Austin Haugh
Lewis Harris
Wm Newkirk
The above 9. Jury men is all that I now recolect.

Verdict
We the Jury find for the commonwealth Wm L Bishop Henry W. Bishop & Marion Porter 30 dollars each
The above is as corect a copy of the warent Jury and verdict as I can give it.
Wm Fox J. P. B. C
